meanings.definition: To insert pages or sections between the pages of a book or document.
meanings.sent1: She decided to interleave colorful pictures throughout the storybook.
meanings.sent2: The printer can interleave the blank pages with the text pages.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to interleave a recipe in the middle of the adventure novel.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to interleave with the rustling of the turning pages.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes interleave to create a beautiful illustration.

meanings.definition: To mix or alternate different elements in a sequence.
meanings.sent1: The DJ likes to interleave fast and slow songs to keep the party going.
meanings.sent2: You can interleave the chocolate and vanilla batter for a marbled cake.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to interleave sweet and savory flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts seemed to interleave in a chaotic dance before the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the rainbow interleave harmoniously in the sky.
